content: Voice acting is great, music is apropreate, and gameplay is fun. It also holds up visually, until I got to Skyskrap where the skybox disapears and models flash in and out of existance if I look at too much of the map. This is also jarring as all the other maps look good to great at best, I hope this gets fixed. Also the game kicks you out if you leave from the mission rewards screen too soon after completion. Aside from that, solid and much needed 40k game.
replyContent: Hi Wolf, sorry to hear about the graphical issue in Skyskrap. We're looking into this now and should hopefully have a fix out soon! If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@phosphorgames.com

content: Love this game, there are some crash bugs still occurring, you can finish a level and it shuts down, but all is saved nothing lost. The story and voices in this are true to the orkdom of 40k, and their qwerks. Hope for more to come, well done, going to buy a model to build like my favourite dakka jet in the game üòÅ
replyContent: Thanks for the kind words and glad you've been having a fun time with Dakka Squadron! We also appreciate the detail on the crash bugs - we'll look into that, it's good to know that they seem to happen at the end of levels. Thanks!

A few crashes so not 5 stars but a great idea executed incredibly well. You can tell that the team are very passionate about 40k and understand what makes orks great. Fantastic attention to detail. The paint colours giving different benefits based on what orks believe they do is an especially nice touch. Well done.
DA ORKZ IZ HEER AN' WE'Z REDY TA KRUMP YA GITZ IN DA SKY! DAKKA DAKKA DAKKA!!!
Very fun game! would reccomend it!

Graphic bugs are fixed now, though still getting the occasional crash (almost never at a point that loses progress) and the performance could be a little better (occasional hitch). Otherwise it's a great little game. Missions are short and sweet, plenty of different craft types and variants with plenty of customisable gubbins and cosmetic elements. It's got the orkiness down without making it grating, and the in-mission guitar noodling has the perfect energy to it. With a little more tuning this is easily worth 5 stars and the asking price. Not a single microtransaction in sight.

No hit detection in landscape whatsoever. Landscape never rendered properly, so I couldn't tell which way was up. Couldn't even finish the tutorial because I couldn't tell what was happening. Shame, game had a load of potential, but I've requested my refund. And before dev posts about an update, you ought to have landscape interactions sorted out before you release a flight sim game.
replyContent: Hi Jordan, we've recently updated the game (v1.2) and should have resolved the issue where plane appeared under the terrain as well as other graphical errors. Please try out the update and let us know if you're still seeing issues!
